description.narrative:
Det föreslagna programmet innehåller ett detaljerat resultatramverk, som har utvecklats i nära samarbete mellan det serbiska inrikesministeriet (MoI) och den svenska polismyndigheten (SPA). Möjligheterna att nå målen ökas genom en nära koppling till den planerade och pågående reformprocessen inom MoI. På grund av detta, bedöms det föreslagna programmet som den mest effektiva formen av stöd. Denna slutsats bygger på tidigare erfarenhet av denna typ av samarbete.
Svensk Polismyndigheten har valts som genomförandepartner på grund av sin unika kompetens och erfarenhet i detta utvecklingssammanhang. Samarbetet mellan Polismyndigheten och det serbiska Inrikesministeriet har pågått sedan 2004 i flera specifika områden av polisarbete. Detta samarbete har vuxit till en partnersamverkan, där den svenska partnern inte bara överför sina kunskaper utan också lär sig och utvecklar viktiga kontakter för sitt eget fortsatta operativa arbete. Regleringsbrevet för 2015 för Polismyndigheten anger fortsatt arbete i utvecklingen av sin strategiska styrning av internationell civil krishantering och internationellt bistånd. Enligt den ska Polismyndigheten lämna en sammanhållen redovisning för svenska rättsvårdande myndigheters fortsatta arbete med att stärka ett sammanhållet rättskedjeperspektiv på områdena internationellt bistånd och internationell civil krishantering. En sådan politisk ram stöder Polisens roll som utvecklingsaktör och gör dem lämpliga genomförandepartner i denna insats.
Budgeten för bidraget är rimlig i förhållande till mål och förväntade resultat. Den presenteras på ett förenklat sätt, vilket är i enlighet med Tjänsteköpsöverenskommelsen mellan Sida och SPA. Den är komponentbaserad och bryts ner inom varje komponent i arvode och ersättningsgilla kostnader. Arvodet kommer att justeras årligen i linje med Ekonomistyrningsverkets (ESV) arvode för myndigheter. Första justeringen skall ske redan i januari 2016. Det finns sju komponenter: Strategisk rådgivare/samordnare, rådgivare för underrättelsestyrt polisverksamhet (Intelligence-Led Policing - ILP), administrativa kostnader, stöd till strategisk ledning, genomförande av ILP-konceptet, stöd till utveckling av kriminalteknik och brottsplatsundersökningar (Crime Scene Investigations - CSI) och stöd till främjande av jämställdhet i MoI. Totala arvoden står för 58.9% av budgeten, varav merparten är reserverad för svenska Polismyndighetens egna anställda. Detta är i linje med tidigare års stöd och bedöms vara rimligt och ett effektivt sätt att använda medel. En liknande bedömning gjordes i den oberoende utvärdering som genomfördes under 2014 ("End Term Evaluation of the Swedish Police Assistance Programme “Development of the Ministry of Interior of the Republic of Serbia 2012-2014”).
Bidraget bedöms som relevant, eftersom det följer nationellt fastställda prioriteringar och är i linje med MoIs och Sveriges strategiska mål.
SPA har kapacitet att uppnå resultaten på ett effektivt sätt. Deras kompetens och färdigheter har visats under åren och de utvecklar sina metoder i enlighet med de nya krav som anges av den svenska regeringen och Sida. Deras kapacitet för intern kontroll har bedömts av Sida vid flera tillfällen och anses tillfredsställande. Interna revisioner har genomförts årligen, men de kommer i framtiden att utföras av en extern, oberoende och kvalificerad revisor, i enlighet med Sidas allmänna villkor för myndighetssamarbete.
Ett starkt lokalt ägarskap och engagemang är kärnan i detta program. Stödet har aktivt sökts av MoI och förslaget utarbetats i nära samråd mellan dem och SPA. MoI äger processen i stor utsträckning, vilket bör bidra till att stärka hållbarheten.
Programmet kombinerar både politiska och tekniska aspekter av reformen inom MoI och Polisdirektoratet. Det bygger på en tydligt uttalad politisk vilja till reformer och fokuserar på att bygga upp kapaciteten hos en hållbar resursbas inom viktiga områden inom MoI och Polisdirektoratet. Metoden är således långsiktig till sin karaktär och fokuserar på att identifiera och utveckla förändringsagenter.
SPA har byggt en god praxis av uppföljning av risker och orsaker till avvikelser i tidigare bidrag och tar in dessa lärdomar i det nya förslaget. Förslaget innehåller en riskanalys för vart och ett av MoIs reformområden vilka kommer att följas upp vid rapportering.
Programmet är i linje med de nationellt fastställda prioriteringarna, men finansieringsmodaliteten är inte i linje med partnerns eget system, eftersom finansiell förvaltning görs helt av SPA. Sida kan fortfarande inte slussa medel genom nationella partnerinstitutioner, eftersom det inte finns någon resultatbaserad budgetering. En programansats är ännu inte möjlig, främst på grund av bristande intresse från andra givare.
Riskerna for effektiviteten och genomförbarheten av programmet har bedömts, dokumenterats och sammanfattats i ett riskanalysregister. Riskerna har bedömts i förhållande till de förväntade resultaten och hänsyn har tagits till principerna för bistandseffektivitet.

The project aims to strengthen the Serbian MoI and the Serbian Police in the process of alignment with the EU acquis through the EU integration. It consists of four components: support to strategic planning, forensics, intelligence-led policing and gender equality. The implementing partner is the Swedish Police.

The overall objective of the programme is to contribute to the MoI's vision: to be a modern, democratic, accountable and efficient police service that will guarantee security acting as a service of the citizens and contribute to sustainable development and European integration.There are four specific objectives/mission statements related to the four thematic components. They are as follows:Project Component: MoI Strategic ProcessesThe mission of the project is to support and build the capacity of the new Sector for International cooperation, EU integration and Planning, especially in its role to support all MoI units to develop and coordinate strategic processes.Project Component: Intelligence-Led Policing (ILP)The project aims to support the Serbian MoI to implement Intelligence-Led Policing (ILP) by supporting the improvement of the police work in preventing and combating crime, further alignment of police practices with European standards and introducing a new approach to the management of the processes for combating crime. Project Component: Crime Scene InvestigationsThe project aims to support the Serbian MoI to further strengthen and consolidate high quality crime scene investigations and assist Serbia's EU accession through support to the implementation of selected sub-chapters of the EU Action Plan for Chapter 24.Project Component: Gender Agenda in the Serbian MoI 2016 - 2018The project aims to support the Serbian police service to implement policies and structures to ensure the retention of female workforce and to tackle existing barriers to progression, including the culture of the police.

tag.narrative: 16.6 - Bygga upp effektiva och transparenta institutioner med ansvarsutkrävande på alla nivåer.
16.6 - Develop effective, accountable and transparent institutions at all levels.
16.7 - Ensure responsive, inclusive, participatory and representative decision-making at all levels.
16.7 - Säkerställa ett lyhört, inkluderande, deltagandebaserat och representativt beslutsfattande på alla nivåer.

16.a - Strengthen relevant national institutions, including through international cooperation, for building capacity at all levels, in particular in developing countries, to prevent violence and combat terrorism and crime.

16.a - Stärka berörda nationella institutioner, bland annat genom internationellt samarbete, i syfte att bygga upp kapacitet på alla nivåer, i synnerhet i utvecklingsländerna, för att förebygga våld och bekämpa terrorism och brottslighet.
5.2 - Avskaffa alla former av våld mot alla kvinnor och flickor i det offentliga och privata rummet, inklusive människohandel, sexuellt utnyttjande och andra typer av exploatering.
5.2 - Eliminate all forms of violence against all women and girls in the public and private spheres, including trafficking and sexual and other types of exploitation.
5.5 - Ensure women’s full and effective participation and equal opportunities for leadership at all levels of decision-making in political, economic and public life.
5.5 - Tillförsäkra kvinnor fullt och faktiskt deltagande och lika möjligheter till ledarskap på alla beslutsnivåer i det politiska, ekonomiska och offentliga livet.

description.narrative: The program results framework was rather ambitious with a considerable number of expected outcomes. Swedish competence has focused on areas that have been identified as catalytic in the current reform context: crime scene investigations, intelligence-led policing (ILP), gender equality and development of the capacities for strategic management. The overall assessment is that the program has initiated a change in all components and delivered on the majority of the results identified in the preparatory phase. It has introduced methodologies and procedures and initiated a change in key processes that was gradually transposed into the Ministry's work practices, laws and secondary legislation, as well as the organizational framework. The systemic change has been primarily and largely based on transformed organizational culture and mind set among the employees. Some of the key results achieved are the following: - Introduction and standardized application of ILP in the four pilot regions of the Serbian Ministry of Interior (MoI), based on the introduction of deconcentrated decision-making forums for operational planning and capacity building in key methods, leading to a more proactive approach and better efficiency in preventing crime. ILP has been adopted as a proactive management model - through the Law on Police, Rulebook on the Way of Performing Police Work and ILP Handbook (policy and procedural level) that was distributed to all senior managers in Regional Police Directorates (RPD) and in all General Police Directorate (GPD) central departments. It has also been made available in digital format on the web site of the MoI, both on the external web and on the intranet in Serbian and in English. Trainings for ILP coordinators, mentors and trainers have been held. ILP training has been made sustainable by establishing a pool of instructors and introducing ILP as an obligatory seminar in the Professional Development Program. An informative/educational ILP website has been launched on the MoI intranet. The new Decree on Internal Organization and Systematization of Job Posts in the MoI accommodates for strengthened analytical capacities at the national, regional and local level. A conceptual model has been developed for the National Criminal Intelligence System, as prescribed in the Action Plan for EU Negotiations for Chapter 24. - Improved inter-agency cooperation and developed methods for ensuring prompt response in cases of Sexual and Gender-Based Violence (SGBV), securing a crime scene and identifying different types of traces and their significance, as well as preserving them to be used as vital evidence in the court. As a result, a steady rise in the number of collected traces that are admissible in the court has been registered in the period 2016-2018 (from 151,374 in 2016, to 170,528 in 2017, to 171,792 in 2018). Manuals and instructions have been produced as part of the Quality Management System, with a particular focus on SGBV. Written procedures and instructions have been developed and training conducted for all relevant actors in the SGBV field: medical staff, judges, prosecutors and NGOs, strengthening their partnership and inter-institutional capacity and improving the overall awareness among the key interlocutors. Procedures and instructions for conducting SGBV investigations have been developed for uniform police officers and distributed in all 27 RPDs. Around 240 police officers have been trained on these topics through seminars held by the National Forensic Center. In total, around 800 persons have attended seminars on crime scene investigation in the cases of SGBV throughout Serbia. 27 specialized victim interview rooms have been established in all RPDs, which is an important change towards a more sensitized approach to victims of SGBV. Additionally, the police officers have been sensitized to victims of gender-based violence. Interview methods and other interactions have been adapted, in order to make the victim feel supported and protected and to prevent secondary victimization. A total of 80 crime scene investigators in all 27 RPDs have been trained in collection, preservation and storage of biological traces, as well as in appropriate treatment of the SGBV victims and making forensic photography of injuries. The program has resulted in the introduction of gender agenda in the MoI's Human Resources Management System, with the development of the mandatory "Guidelines for Implementation of Measures to Achieve Gender Equality in the MoI through the Human Resources Management System". The application of guidelines in in-house recruitment and selection procedures for higher leadership positions within the MoI started even before their formal adoption. This has resulted in the appointment of two women to the positions of Heads of RPDs (out of four candidates). The program has created the normative framework for the prevention and protection from different forms of dscrimination through the adoption of an internal act titled "Mechanisms for prevention and protection from gender-based discrimination, sexual harassment and discrimination based on other personal characteristics in the MoI" and a "Handbook on dealing with cases of gender-based discrimination and discrimination based on other personal characteristics in the MoI". The establishment of the Policewomen's Network is another significant achievement. The Network gathers women from all operational and organizational units of the MoI, serving as a vehicle for further institutionalization of gender equality in the MoI. Through the pilot Gender Coaching Program, 6 senior managers have been trained to integrate gender perspective in their decisions and operative procedures. All 6 managers have developed individual action plans for improved gender equality in their respective organizational units, which is a step towards further institutionalization of gender equality in the MoI. The Gender Coaching Program has been recognized as very successful even by civil society organizations (Kvinna till Kvinna). The program has supported the establishment and functioning of the Analytical Group for the follow-up of the implementation of the National Action Plan for the UN Security Council Resolution 1325 (Women, Peace and Security). 18 women employees of the MoI have been trained in gender perspective in public policy and reporting required under the UNSCR 1325. 14 women from the Analytical Group have been trained in gender equality and gender-based discrimination. Staff of the Sector for International Cooperation, EU Affairs and Planning have been trained in impact assessment, project and program evaluation, EU policy cycle, programming and implementation of EU assistance. Standardized Operative Procedures for implementing development assistance have been developed and distributed to managers in all organizational units. A normative framework and plan for participating in civilian missions has been designed. The program for training for operational mid and senior management level has been designed and institutionalized. It is included in the systematization and organizational structure of the MoI as a precondition for career development and promotion to higher managerial positions.
No indicator available - only a description of the activity results is published
